Sentencas: Transient impacts on the performance of solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine (SOFC/GT) hybrid systems were investigated using hardware-in-the-loop simulations (HiLSs) at a test facility located at the U. S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory.
Titulo: Fuel Composition Transients in Fuel Cell Turbine Hybrid for Polygeneration Applications

Sentencas: The work focused on applications relevant to polygeneration systems, which require significant fuel flexibility.
Titulo: Fuel Composition Transients in Fuel Cell Turbine Hybrid for Polygeneration Applications

Sentencas: Specifically, the dynamic response of implementing a sudden change in fuel composition from syngas to methane was examined.
Titulo: Fuel Composition Transients in Fuel Cell Turbine Hybrid for Polygeneration Applications

Sentencas: The maximum range of possible fuel composition allowable within the constraints of carbon deposition in the SOFC and stalling/surging of the turbine compressor system was determined.
Titulo: Fuel Composition Transients in Fuel Cell Turbine Hybrid for Polygeneration Applications

Sentencas: It was demonstrated that the transient response was significantly impact the fuel cell dynamic performance, which mainly drives the entire transient in SOFC/GT hybrid systems.
Titulo: Fuel Composition Transients in Fuel Cell Turbine Hybrid for Polygeneration Applications

Sentencas: This resulted in severe limitations on the allowable methane concentrations that could be used in the final fuel composition when switching from syngas to methane.
Titulo: Fuel Composition Transients in Fuel Cell Turbine Hybrid for Polygeneration Applications

Sentencas: Several system performance parameters were analyzed to characterize the transient impact over the course of 2 h from the composition change.
Titulo: Fuel Composition Transients in Fuel Cell Turbine Hybrid for Polygeneration Applications
